statement.title: Problem Description
statement.content:
Giving two strings and you should judge if they are matched.
The first string contains lowercase letters and uppercase letters.
The second string contains lowercase letters, uppercase letters, and special symbols: “.” and “*”.
. can match any letter, and * means the front character can appear any times. For example, “a.b” can match “acb” or “abb”, “a*” can match “a”, “aa” and even empty string. ( “*” will not appear in the front of the string, and there will not be two consecutive “*”.

statement.title: Input
statement.content:
The first line contains an integer T implying the number of test cases. (T≤15)
For each test case, there are two lines implying the two strings (The length of the two strings is less than 2500).

statement.title: Output
statement.content: For each test case, print “yes” if the two strings are matched, otherwise print “no”.

statement.title: Sample Input
statement.content:
3
aa
a*
abb
a.*
abb
aab
